Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is looking for an experienced Communications Manager to lead communications for Facebook’s Ethics & Compliance function. This is a brand-new role with global reach in a dynamic, fast-paced team. This person will be responsible for the effective design of long-term communications strategies for both internal and external audiences while executing against day-to-day communications needs in collaboration with the Legal, Internal Communications, HR, Policy, and other stakeholders within Facebook. The successful candidate will design, execute, and manage an Ethics & Compliance communication strategy that improves awareness and drives understanding and engagement related to ethics and compliance program needs. You should be exceptionally organized and detail oriented, capable of managing cross-functional projects and work streams end to end, with an aptitude for prioritization. Strong writing and editing skills are essential—specifically the ability to communicate complex, technical concepts to diverse audiences in a clear and concise manner.
Develop an Ethics & Compliance communications strategy that supports the organization’s goals and focus areasDevelop and maintain a global Ethics & Compliance editorial calendarCoordinate with cross-functional team to implement consistent communications across Facebook offices and teamsDevelop and create a wide range of internal and external communications materials including posts, creation of wikis/websites, blog posts, communications plans, statements, briefing materials for executives and moreDevelop, execute, and manage global communications and campaigns, applying a consistent brandDraft, edit, and review existing policies partnering with legal, HR, internal communications, and other teams to develop and execute change management and communications plansConsult with functional ethics & compliance leaders about their communications strategies, and provide editing support across the organization to ensure consistencyCreate change management strategies and plans that support key initiatives and program rolloutsCreate and maintain a way to gather feedback about initiatives and measure communication effectiveness
Bachelor’s degree in related field and 12+ years experience in a communications roleExperience in internal and external communicationsExperience managing multiple projects simultaneously and working autonomouslyExperience turning complex information into relevant, engaging, timely and valuable content for different audiencesExperience working collaboratively with cross-functional groups including Legal, Policy, Brand, Marketing, and ResearchExperience identifying communication issues and solving problems using judgment and analysis, providing communications guidance and supportMedia relations and social media analytics skills and strategic thinking skillsExperience scaling a communications programExperience working with executives in fast-paced, regulated environments
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.
Title: Communications Manager, Ethics & Compliance

Description:
The HR Specialist VI, reports to the Director of the Senior HR Business Partners Group. Manages and reviews Centralized Accounting and Payroll/Personnel System (CAPPS) system access requests to human resources payroll and personnel system (HRPS)-related modules. Acts as the agency primary contact with the agency’s HRPS contractor. Responsible for leading projects and project teams related to HRPS contract activities.
Serves as account supervisor and administrator for the agency’s Department of Public Safety (DPS) Secure Site user portal.
Provides consultation regarding state and federal legislation, statutes, rules and regulations regarding criminal history records and pre- and post-employment due diligence policies and procedures.
Assists with the administration and coordination of classification program issues and responsibilities in the delivery of classification and salary administration policies, programs and services for the agency. Assists with DFPS Human Resources classification, organizational advisory and review functions. Provides consultation to agency management and staff regarding classification and compensation statutes, policies, procedures and regulations. Participates in and may lead classification and compensation projects and studies May manage job audit appeals policies and procedures. Reviews, analyzes, and recommends changes to human resources policies and procedures on classification and compensation.
Prepares reports, data analyses, and policy interpretations on state and federal laws, regulations, policies and procedures related to all HR functions and develops recommendations regarding exceptions to human resources policies.
Serves as an employment and human resources policy subject matter expert, and provides guidance and consultation regarding human resources policies, processes, policy development and revision to DFPS management, staff, and external agencies and entities. Provides interpretations of human resources policies and processes and advises human resources staff and agency management and staff regarding complex employment, policy, process and other related human resources matters and problems. Evaluates human resources industry trends, approaches, current and proposed legislation and case law, and develops evaluations and recommendations. Identifies current or anticipated policy and organizational issues and concerns and develops recommendations and solutions.
Analyzes current and proposed legislation and assesses potential or actual agency human resources-related impact. Develops responses related to legislative changes or inquiries for management or agency leadership. Conducts periodic analyses to evaluate organizational and administrative effects of changes to human resources policies.
Researches and develops solutions to complex employment and human resources management issues. Develops and delivers in-depth human resources-related training for agency management and staff. Facilitates and performs special projects, studies and assignments as needed. Represents Human Resources at meetings, conferences, workgroups, hearings and other events as needed. Performs other duties as assigned.
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.
Serves as the HR and agency point of contact with the Human Resources Payroll System (HRPS) contractor. Serves as the subject matter expert on all issues related to the HRPS contract, functionality, adaptation, and implementation of updates and new processes. Attends CAPPS HR Business Partner meetings on behalf of DFPS HR. Provides HRPS support regarding agency testing, change management processes, and agency wide communication and training. 20%
Assists with the administration and coordination of classification program issues and responsibilities in the delivery of classification and salary administration policies, programs and services for the agency. Assists with the DFPS Human Resources classification and organizational advisory and review functions. Provides consultation to agency management and staff on classification planning, organizational design and structure, career track programs and associated tenure and merit-based promotion programs, position classification and compensation principles, statutes, regulations and policies. Facilitates complex classification and position management programs and plans and manages complex classification projects and studies. Provides guidance and technical assistance regarding agency job audit policies and processes, exception requests, classification processes, concepts and determinations, organizational structure and impact of changes and reporting relationships. (10%)
Helps coordinate classification actions affecting programs or significant numbers of agency positions and functional areas. Evaluates problems, deficiencies, and inadequacies in classification programs and policies, and develops proposals and recommendations to address identified issues. Provides advice and consultation to agency programs in establishing new or reorganized functions that have program or agency impact, or are significant or complex. Serves as a subject matter expert and provides guidance regarding state classification programs, requirements, position management, compensation, salary administration, related policy interpretation and consultation with all levels of management, executive leadership, agency staff and internal and external entities. Manages classification and compensation studies, obtain reports, analyzes data, and develops guidance and recommendations. Facilitates classification and position changes and corrections as appropriate. Provides technical guidance regarding state classification plans, the federal Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA), position FLSA assessments and position descriptions including guidance regarding position benchmarking and standardization principles and concepts. (10%)
Manages job audit appeals policies and procedures and evaluates appealed agency job audit classification determinations. Assesses the appealed classification decision and renders a determination regarding final classification of the appealed position. Reviews, analyzes, and recommends changes to human resources policies and procedures regarding job audits, classification, organizational structure, corresponding salary administration policies and reorganizations. Prepares reports, data analyses, and policy interpretations on state and federal laws, regulations, policies and procedures regarding the FLSA, salary administration and classification. Serves as a compensation and classification subject matter expert. Reviews, analyzes and interprets state and federal legislation and applies to current classification and salary administration policies, procedures and programs. (10%)
Develops written assessments, evaluations and recommendations for management and agency leadership review regarding management requests for human resources policy exceptions. Evaluates the rationale and basis for requests for exceptions to agency human resources policies, conducts related research of relevant statutes, regulations, policies, rules, regulations and processes; assesses impact and outcome of exceptions to human resources policies and develops written recommendations and reports for agency leadership review. Provides technical guidance regarding outcomes and results of human resources policy exceptions. Conducts research and assessments related to human resources policy waiver requests. (10%)
Manages and reviews Centralized Accounting and Payroll/Personnel System (CAPPS) system access requests to human resources payroll and personnel system-related modules and determines appropriate responses regarding granting or denying CAPPS system human resources-related system module access requests. Coordinates with CAPPS system access staff to grant or deny CAPPS HCM module access. Serves as account supervisor and administrator for the agency’s Department of Public Safety (DPS) Secure Site user portal for access and review of criminal history records accessed for pre-and post-employment due diligence. Regulates appropriate level of employee access to the DPS Secure Site portal criminal history and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) fingerprint records and communications, and provides guidance and technical assistance regarding access, use and dissemination of DPS criminal history records, accounts and information. Provides consultation regarding state and federal legislation, statutes, rules and regulations regarding criminal history records, agency bars and contraindications to employment, and agency policies and procedures regarding criminal history checks and pre- and post-employment due diligence policies and procedures. Manages communications with DPS regarding criminal history records, account management and agency usage. Serve as the human resources point of contact regarding agency communications with the DPS regarding the agency’s pre- and post-employment utilization of criminal history records for employment purposes. (10%)
Serves as an employment and human resources policy subject matter expert, and provides guidance and consultation regarding human resources policies, processes, policy development and revision to DFPS management, staff, and external agencies and entities. Provides direction and guidance to human resources personnel regarding complex or conflicting human resources and employment-related federal and state statutes, regulations, rules, policies and processes. Provides interpretations of human resources policies and processes, advises human resources staff and agency management and staff regarding complex policy, classification, compensation, recruitment and selection, due diligence or employee relations matters and problems, and develops solutions and recommendations. Serves as an advisor to ensure HR policies and procedures are in compliance with federal and state employment statutes, regulations and rules, and functions as a liaison for internal and external auditors to provide human resources policy and process interpretation and information. Assesses internal and external audit results to identify, prioritize and address risks and make recommendations for policy and process changes. (15%)
Researches and evaluates human resources industry trends, approaches, current and proposed legislation and case law, and develops written assessments, evaluations and recommendations. Identifies current or anticipated policy and organizational issues and concerns and develops recommendations and solutions. Reviews and analyzes current and proposed legislation and assesses potential or actual agency human resources-related impact and changes to human resources policies and programs. Provides guidance and consultation to human resources personnel and agency management and staff regarding policies, guidelines and state and federal legislative changes and updates. Develops responses related to legislative changes or inquiries for management or agency leadership. Conducts periodic analyses to evaluate organizational and administrative effects of changes to human resources policies. Researches and develops solutions to complex issues related to employment and human resources management. Develops solutions to problems with human resources policies, procedures or applications of human resources policies and processes. (10%)
Develops and delivers in-depth training for agency management and staff on employment concepts and human resources and policy-related topics including, but not limited to classification, compensation, the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA), the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), performance management, employee performance evaluation policies, processes, principles and approaches, and corrective and disciplinary actions. Develops training and presentation materials, and revises training and presentation materials as appropriate in accordance with current legislation, policies, processes, regulations and rules. Facilitates and performs special projects, studies and assignments as needed. Represents Human Resources at meetings, conferences, workgroups, hearings and other events as needed. Performs other duties as assigned. (5%)
Business systems thinking, information technology and the impact on the HR programs efficiency and effectiveness.Strategic workforce planning.Federal and state employment statutes, regulations, rules and policies.Agency mission, employee and manager roles, organizational planning processes, client and organizational cultures, and public service environment.Knowledge of local, state, and federal laws, policies, and best practices relating to health and human services, business fundamentals, key internal and external customers, and individual and team behaviors.HR and employment guidelines, policies and procedures, key business fundamentals, key internal and external customers and individual and team behaviors.Knowledge of the Texas Legislative process and a familiarity with legislative tracking systems such as Texas Legislature Online and Legislative Tracking System (LTS).Principles, concepts and methodology of the state classification plan, compensation principles, procedures and practices; organizational structure, division responsibilities and key staff.Agency mission, employee and manager roles, organizational planning process, client and organizational cultures and the public service environment.Organizational planning processes.Training development, procedures and techniques.Principles and practices of public administration and human resources management.
Effective interaction with staff at all levels, other state agencies and internal and external organizations.Analytical thinking.Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook, PowerPoint and other computer programs and applications.Research methods and analysis.Consensus building.Consultation and negotiation.Instructing and training others.Mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building.
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.Think and act strategically and innovatively.Assess and balance competing requirements and priorities.Manage conflict, model ethical behavior and build trust relationships.Manage relationships and engage stake holders.Analyze data, and develop customer feedback surveys.Effectively manage resources.Apply mentoring, coaching, and counseling skills to develop talent.Apply organizational, classification and compensation principles.Communicate effectively orally and in writing for a diverse range of audiences and purposes.Develop effective solutions to mission requirements using principles/programs.Manage conflict and model ethical behavior.Understand, analyze, research and develop business processes and policies.Develop training objectives and assess the effectiveness of training.
SHRM-Senior Certified Professional (SCP) or closely-related Human Resources professional certification preferred.
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university. Major coursework in human resources, public administration, organizational development, or closely related field preferred.
Four years of full-time employment experience in a professional human resources role may be substituted for the required degree with a maximum substitution of four (4) years.
Five (5) years of full-time professional employment experience in a human resources department or office. CAPPS experience, HRPS contract experience, management or team lead experience. Description:
Urban Green Tree Services is currently hiring an experienced ISA Certified Arborist
Good candidates must have a minimum of three years experience in tree industry sales with an established tree services company.
Urban Green offers competitive pay and reasonable work hours.
All candidates must be safety minded and work as team players at all times. This requirement is non-negotiable.
The candidate must live in the Austin area or be willing to relocate to the Austin area.

Must have or obtain ISA Arborist Certification within 6 months.Background in forestry, preferential consideration for forestry degree.Must be experienced with native and common trees in Austin and Central Texas area including ash junipers, live oak, red oak, cedar, pecan, plums, pears, peaches and pomegranates. Expertise in oak wilt prevention and care highly desirable.Skilled in the symbiotic relationship between trees, bees, birds and other creatures.Must display confidence and be charismatic with customers and show respect to tree crew members.Must have excellent listening skills, articulate and have excellent written communication skills.Safety-focused knowledge is required.Able to successfully follow directions and complete requests.Strong work ethic and team-focused.Drug or alcohol usage during work hours will result in immediate termination without pay.Valid Texas Driver’s License with a clean driving record is required.Bilingual (Spanish) is preferred.

All Laundry machines, Ice machines, Elevators, Pool & Electrical Equipment, etc.). Maintains and services pool and spa areas including testing and recording as stated by City and State regulations.Able to assist the Catering department in room/function set-ups (I.e. tables, chairs, equipment, etc.)Fully knowledgeable in the hotel key system (I.e. programming locks, lock overrides, lock reporting, making/issuing keys, etc.).Fully knowledgeable in the hotel’s emergency procedures.Adhere to and follow all safety procedures.Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Must be able to convey information and ideas clearlyMust be able to evaluate and choose alternate courses of action quickly and accuratelyMust be effective in handling problems in the workplace, including anticipating, preventing, identifying and solving problems as necessaryMust have the ability to gather information from all sources available and know how to use this information to best resolve a problem or needMust be effective in listening to and understanding the concerns and issues raised by other employees or customersMust be able to prioritize and delegate work as neededMust communicate effectively with all levels of managementMaintain high standards of personal appearance and groomingMaintain regular attendanceComputer proficiency and technical aptitude with the ability to utilize MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook)Ability to effectively plan, set priorities and manage several complex projects simultaneously while working under pressure to meet deadlinesAbility to exercise considerable judgment and discretion when dealing with matters of significance for the companyAbility to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, customers and patronsMust be flexible to provide assistance to management team in a 24/7 operating environmentMust have reliable transportation

Working extended hours may be required as neededRegularly required to stand, walk, sit, use repetitive wrist and finger movement, handle or feel objects, reach with hands and arms, climb stairs, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawlLifting 20 – 75 lbs.

Description:
Working within the Talent Management Center of Excellence (COE), the Organizational Development & Effectiveness Specialist is responsible for leading and supporting the assessment of organizational needs. Assists with operationalizing and enabling Organizational Development strategies under the direction of the Vice President of Talent Management. Serves as the subject matter expert for organizational development and effectiveness by working with senior leaders as a trusted advisor. Proactively aids in establishing processes that enables consistency and quality in building organizational capability to achieve the company’s goals and objectives. The ODES will collaborate with TMS Centers of Excellence, TMS Business Partners, L&D, TMS Insights, Talent Management and the business to develop programs that enhance our ability to lead, attract, and retain talent. Establish and foster a systems perspective within the organization as it relates to Talent Strategies. The ODES will support and implement programs that focus on addressing workforce capabilities while, identifying business performance barriers and opportunities, determine underlying causes, focus on system impacts, clarify potential consequences of various interventions and implement alternatives that provide long term benefits. Learns and lives the company’s mission, purpose, leadership principles, and core values.
Serves as a trusted advisor to TMS (HR) BP’s and leaders on change management, team effectiveness, and leadership development.Assesses OD needs of operating, business and functional units.Leads the design, development and implementation of programs policies and strategies tailored to meet OD needs and program goals and coaching to leaders regarding OD methods and tools.Designs and executes key programmatic elements of the OD process.Evaluates strategies and programs to measure the achievement of established goals.Defines, designs and facilitates virtual, live or blended sessions tailored to the business need.Partners with Talent Management Program Leader on the implementation of succession planning processes that drive talent mobility, development and promotions of executives and emerging leaders.Partners with the Compensation COE to define and develop career ladders for all functions, formalize job families, and documented career paths.Cultivates a positive relationship with Team Member Engagement/Experience, L&D, Talent Management leaders and the business by understanding business issues and how they translate into people strategy and concrete measures /tracking of impact.Stays abreast of talent trends and advance thinking around solutions to further develop talent and organizational effectiveness.Performs other duties as assigned.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to develop and influence relationships and partnerships (internal/external) across all levels or the organization, exhibiting strong leadership and influencing skills.Demonstrated skills and experience in supporting strategy implementation in a large complex organization.Expert consulting, design and facilitation skills.Strong command of models, frameworks, tools and solution to increase leadership effectiveness. Including but not limited to behavioral change, organizational effectiveness, emotional intelligence, change leadership, high performing team coaching and effectiveness.Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills, and a high level of personal integrity.Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education and experience.5-8 years’ experience as a Human Resource Business Partner5+ years’ experience designing and delivering OD/OE programs.5+ years’ People leadership or team leadership experience.Relevant certifications in organizational and individual assessment instruments or SHRM-CP/SCP.

Description:
RetailMeNot is looking for friendly, intelligent people to join our Customer Support team here in Austin!
In this role, you will complete functions central to meeting quality and customer support goals on RetailMeNot, Inc.’s web properties. You will be trained on all team processes and functions as well as contributing to meeting team goals.
Interested? Please read on!Who You AreYou have 1-2+ years prior customer support experienceYou have the ability to provide a phenomenal customer support experience in e-mail, chat, and/or phone channelsYou work quickly and efficiently, while maintaining high quality standards to meet team and/or individual goals, results focusedYou are comfortable with high volumes of data and queue-based work, while maintaining SLA’s (service level agreement)Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a dynamic and fast-paced environmentCan be available to work weekend shifts when neededSalesforce experience a plusCan spot a good deal from 50 feet away and love saving money for yourself and othersWhat You'll DoYou will provide email, chat and social media-based customer support to RetailMeNot usersYou will help customers with their online experienceYou will validate online coupons and deals content to ensure correct information is on the siteWork on special projects as needed
Rewards*We offer an opportunity to be an integral part of a company that eagerly pursues disruption in its space to continue to drive innovation and lead the competition. Benefits of being an employee of RetailMeNot, Inc. include, but are not limited to the following:
About UsRetailMeNot, Inc. is a leading savings destination bringing people and the things they lovetogether through savings with retailers, brands, restaurants and pharmacies. RetailMeNotmakes everyday life more affordable through online and in-store coupon codes, cash backoffers, and the RetailMeNot Deal Finder™ browser extension. Savings are also provided inconsumers’ mailboxes through the RetailMeNot Everyday™ direct mail package, and at thepharmacy with RxSaver by RetailMeNot.
RetailMeNot is a Vericast business. To learn more, visit http://www.retailmenot.com/corp orfollow @RetailMeNot on social media.

Title: Customer Care Coordinator (Contractor)

Description:
We Are Hiring
Customer Service Representative - SFPH SFD Davis Lane - Full-Time, Day - SFD at Davis Lane - Austin, TX
Why Join Ascension?
Ascension Seton, based in Austin, Texas, is a faith-based non-profit healthcare system founded in 1902 by the Daughters of Charity. Called to be a sign of God’s unconditional love for all, Ascension Seton strives to expand access to high-quality, low-cost, person-centered care and services. Ascension Seton operates more than 100 clinical locations, including four teaching hospitals which serve as training sites for Dell Medical School at The University of Texas.
Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the leading non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, especially to those most in need. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs.
What You Will Do
As an Associate with Seton Family of Hospitals-TX, you will have the opportunity to perform a variety of customer service functions.
Handles customer service inquiries and problems. Provides orientation and education for various types of equipment to customers. May also include instructions on patient owned repairs.Uses systems for tracking, information gathering, or troubleshooting.Responds to inquiries and may refer customers to secondary sources.Maintains records as appropriate.
What You Will Need
DiplomaHigh school diploma or GED required.
None required.
Title: Customer Service Representative (Full Time, Days)

Description:
So, what does a TaskUs Project Manager really do? Think of yourself as a driver of results for TaskUs- road mapping, planning, documenting, and executing. Imagine going to work with one goal in mind: helping build and lead the innovative force behind TaskUs and some of the world’s most disruptive companies. You map requirements, plan solutions, confer with experts, and successfully execute strategies to roll out projects squarely aimed at turning the industry on its head. Your portfolio can contain a variety of projects from client implementations, site builds, and strategic company initiatives. Your achievements are gauged not on hours worked, but on the success or failure of projects. You put the “CAN” in “that CAN’T be done.”
Develop project plans utilizing standardized documentation templates such as WBS, formal agendas, and action item trackers, managing the documentation and completion throughout the project lifecycle.Engage key stakeholders and project sponsors from discovery to project close, prioritizing and managing scope, cost, and timelinesHost weekly syncs, documenting milestones, action items, and escalation points.Conduct deep-dive meetings with stakeholders and SMEs as projects dictate, documenting minutes and actions required, and developing timelines for resolution.Validate the workflows and processes of incoming opportunities.Act as a communication champion, managing expectations and competing agendas of various stakeholders and project priorities.Collaborate with internal and external partners on process and operational improvements throughout the project cycle, troubleshooting when discrepancies arise.Manage client relationships and expectations throughout the project life cycle.Conduct project closure processes and contribute to organization-wide procedure improvements using lessons learned.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent business project management experience.3-5 years of experience in project management.2+ years in operations and/or account management, working directly with clients.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong problem-solving skills.Excellent attention to detail with a commitment to accuracy and quality.Self-starter willing to support their project teams.
Relevant BPO experience.PMP, Agile, and/or Lean Six Sigma experience and/or certifications.International vendor management experience.Experience building new sites or launching new geos.Advanced knowledge of email ticketing and cloud-based systems (i.e., 8x8, Aircall, Five9, Salesforce, Zendesk).
TaskUs is the fastest growing tech-enabled business services company in the world, delivering the customer support, AI operations and content security services that power the world’s most innovative companies. Listed as one of Glassdoor‘s “100 Best Places to Work”, USA Today’s “Best Company Cultures” and “Best Companies for Women” by Comparably, TaskUs is a Frontline-First company that puts its people at the heart of everything they do.
TaskUs has been recognized as one of the Inc. “500 Fastest Growing Private Companies in America” for the past seven years consecutively. Founded in 2008 by Bryce Maddock and Jaspar Weir, the company raised over $250mm in 2018 from the world’s largest private equity firm, Blackstone.
TaskUs currently has over 20,000 employees and offices across the U.S., Philippines, India, Taiwan, Mexico, Ireland and Greece.
TaskUs, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.
To find out more visit www.TaskUs.com.
TaskUs, LLC. is an equal opportunity employer.

Description:
Training Specialist IVPerforms highly complex (senior-level) training work producing and/or delivering instructor-led or computer-based training. Work involves analyzing training needs and developing and evaluating training programs. Develops training products and services to support the knowledge and skills development of employees of HHS agencies. Develops and implements instructor-led and computer-based courses to ensure they meet customer standards, state laws and policies, agency policies, procedures, and guidelines. Work is performed individually or in collaboration with other Instructional Designers, video production staff, subject matter experts, and project stakeholders within and outside the system.Works with limited supervision under the Director of Competency Training and Development, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
1. Designs, develops, formats, reviews, revises, implements and evaluates training curricula and materials to fill identified training gaps/needs and meet applicable state laws, agency policies, procedures, and guidelines for state hospital and state supported living center (SSLC) facilities to ensure deadlines are met and training products meet departmental standards, deadlines, and the specific requirements of the customer and the needs of the audience. (45%)2. Serves as the process expert and provides quality control over all training products developed for state supported living centers (SSLCs) including providing guidance for the development of courses by other developers, analyzing training needs, and evaluating training projects for suitability for inclusion in established training programs. (25%)3. Develops, conducts, and coordinates classroom training and/or facilitates workgroups and meetings to further departmental goals and provide training resources and guidance to facility training departments to meet training needs and provide specialized training and/or staff development. (15%)
4. Works in conjunction with other department team members to create products, or complete projects that benefit customers, depending on the needs of the department, as assigned. (15%)
Knowledge of training procedures and techniques, adult education principles, instructional design and/or curriculum development; interpersonal relations.
Skills in using Microsoft Office Suite; oral and written communication; time management, training content delivery.
Ability to formulate and evaluate learning objectives, evaluate effectiveness of training delivery; communicate complex information in a way that is tailored to the audience of learners; ability to gather, assemble, correlate, and analyze facts; establish goals and objectives; trouble shoot and devise solutions to problems; provide guidance to others.
Experience in training work. A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in instructional design, training, education, adult learning, or a related field, plus related work experience. Experience working at a state hospital or state supported living center. Experience may be substituted for education on a year for year basis.

Company: My Love Fur Paws Pet Care, LLC
Description:
Our organization is about people and their dogs. It’s about helping people and INSPIRING them to do more with and more for their dogs. We are a group of energetic, motivated people who love what we do and are looking for other like-minded, high-quality people to join us. We offer exciting opportunities that will challenge your abilities, expand your skills and reward your contributions. Our Leadership Team is passionate about fostering both personal and professional growth for all.
This position we are currently hiring for is at our location where we offer several different services for people and their pets. It is a full-time or part-time opportunity, 20-40 hours per week, including weekend work and, also, must be flexible to work extra hours when needed. This is a Pet Care position with a great support staff and leadership team that you would be joining.
Safety is the responsibility of each individual and management expects all work to be done in a safe manner.
At our facility we have a three phase hiring process. Only those who complete ALL phases will be considered for employment.
ONLY ONLINE APPLICATIONS WILL BE ACCEPTED.
JOB DESCRIPTIONPets in our facility must be cared for promptly, every day. The facility is staffed 365 days a year and is exceptionally busy during all holidays and summer months. Experience is preferable; however a genuine love for animals is mandatory. You must be able to handle dogs of all sizes without being afraid of them and without allowing them to control you. You must be in good physical condition, able to squat, stoop, bend, lift and do a lot of walking. You also MUST be willing to maintain the highest standards in cleanliness. There will be opportunities for advancement, if you excel.
All employees must be able to read, write legibly and communicate clearly in English both in person and on the telephone. Employees must have good oral and written communication skills including the ability to listen, talk, write, type and otherwise communicate with professionalism and tact. Proper grammar, spelling and punctuation are expected.Basic computer literacy including the ability to type on a computer keyboard, use a computer mouse and view information on a computer screen is required.You Are Dependable – being a few minutes early for work is normal for you. You look at what the great day ahead spent with dogs will bring. Our staff knows they can count on you to do whatever it is you are assigned with excellence.You Love the Details – as a team, we want to make sure each guests’ needs are met. From medications to meals and play times to pampering, it is all in the details to make our guests stay the best it can be.You Are a Team Player – you want the best for the dogs that are staying with us and work as a team member to get that accomplished. You add to the conversation and brainstorm with fellow staff on ways to make the experience more enriching.You Are a Goal-Setter – you have goals for your work and for yourself. At our facility we have built a work culture where accomplishing goals is key to success. We have educational opportunities and areas that you can grow in as you deepen your experience in the pet care field.
Be able to lift 40 lbs.Previous dog experience (even if it’s just that you have owned a dog)Good dog handling
As a part of our Team, you are involved with all of the day-to-day activities that happen at our facility. You are the key to each pet’s stay, making sure everything they need is happening. You ensure our dog guests have a great vacation while their owners are away. As the primary contact person with our dog guests, you are responsible for:
Expectations and Duties
Customer ServiceLearn how to greet clients with a friendly demeanor when receiving or handing off a dog.Dog CareEnsure that the dogs have fresh water at all times.Making sure every guest is comfortable, happy and receiving all of the services that an owner requests.Maintaining the daily duties and in a timely manner including properly cleaning and disinfecting all enclosures, play yards and common areas as well as general housekeeping throughout the entire facility.Learn what information to provide for daily reports.Learn how to perform feedings accurately and pass on communication if dogs are not eating.Assist in the integration of new dogs into the play areas following the protocol and evaluate throughout the day.Learn how to intake daycare dogs safely and in a controlled manner.Learn how to intake boarding dogs safely and in a controlled manner, ensure that all belongings are reviewed and labeled by name, feeding/med instructions are provided and that all boarding check in questions have been answered.Learn how to set up dogs in the evening and consult with owners on proper sleeping arrangements.Learn how to read and implement our scorecards as necessary.Learn how to hand off dogs following procedure.Observe the work we are doing with the dogs on the floor to continue our commitment to training and keeping the dogs engaged in a positive manner on the floor.Assist Spa when needed and help groomer retrieve dogs from play arenas.Ensure that all dogs are kept clean by any means necessary.Observe dogs for any and all odd behaviors, signs of illness or injury and report to Manager if anything of concern comes to your attention.Conduct daily health evaluations. Closely monitoring the health and wellness of every guest.Constantly observe dogs by feeling, looking at feet, ears, teeth, etc., so we can communicate to clients when a dog is in need of a nail trim, FUR-minator, paw treatment or if there’s anything concerning that a vet should look at.Feeding and medicating guests, and keeping detailed records of our guests entire stay.Making sure every guest goes home clean, happy and we exceeded the expectation.FacilitiesMaintaining a highest level of cleanliness in all areas of our facility inside and in play yards.Teamwork/CommunicationEnsure that all notes are passed along to next shift’s teammateCommunicate clearly with our leadership team.
DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION
High school diploma or equivalentPrevious experience in a pet facility or pet care environment a plusExcellent work history and references
COMPENSATIONPay depends on experience and you will receive performance based bonus upon approval. We don’t hire to just fill a position, rather we take our time looking for the right people. If you know without a doubt that you are a fit, let’s talk.
We Really Believe in This StuffEveryday. we get to be a part of something bigger than ourselves. Providing inspiration to dog parents who need it. Getting our message out there. Helping customers learn how to change the course of their relationship with their dogs. Educating the dog owner how to speak “dog.” Making the connection between dog and owner is the goal for us. It’s why we do what we do. Work that changes lives, work that gives inspiration.
Work in Your Strengths
Our goal is to help position each team member in a role that plays to their strengths, that sets them up to shine … to win. Know yourself well enough to know what you do well, and just as importantly, what you don’t do well.
Win or Lose as a Team
Our team openly works together to create remarkable experiences that positively impacts lives. Everyone on the team is responsible for bringing new ideas, perspectives and solutions to the table. Starting with day one, we want your voice as part of the conversation.
About Our Company
We’re a privately-owned and operated dog care facility focused on a single mission: ”We provide experience-based, canine education and services to improve the canine/human relationship which gives INSPIRATION to everyone from the dog enthusiast to the dog owner.”

None

About BigIron Auction Company
BigIron is committed to providing honesty and integrity through our state-of-the-art online auction platform. We are continually focused on helping the agricultural community connect buyers and sellers. Through this commitment, we have grown to become the largest, unreserved online auction serving rural America, selling tens of thousands of items through weekly auctions to registered bidders worldwide.

General Notes
The Program Manager for Graduate Communities provides leadership for collaborative program and resource development to enhance the quality and quantity of personalized professional development services for under-represented graduate students. The incumbent leads relationship management to advance collaborations with graduate student leaders, campus departments, career center offices, and the Graduate School to strengthen identity-based professional development and career support. This position also provides individual and group career and professional development advising to cultivate a diverse and empowered graduate community.
ResponsibilitiesCollaborative Program and Resource Development – through collaboration with identity-based graduate student groups and UT offices who work closely with historically under-represented graduate students (e.g. Faculty Innovation Center, Gender and Sexuality Center, Veterans Services, Multicultural Center), the successful candidate will develop a portfolio of programs and resources that serve specific population needs related to career and professional development. This includes building a graduate peer network to conduct outreach, lead programs, and develop targeted resources. Topics of particular interest include mentorship development, self-advocacy, leadership, individual development planning, and authentic professionalization.Provide individual and group career and professional development advising across disciplines – demonstrated understanding and commitment to the unique needs of master’s and doctoral students and postdoctoral scholars. Clear understanding of the hiring landscape and national trends for doctoral students with a deep understanding of academic job hiring in addition to advanced degree hiring in industry, business, government, and nonprofit.Provide leadership to ensure all TCE graduate team programming and resources are inclusive, and oversee team training on specific issues related to diversity and inclusion for advanced degree students (e.g.; neurodiversity, inclusive workshop design, and advising best practices). Provide thought leadership and contribute to the university, state and national initiatives .Working closely with the Associate Director of Graduate Employer Education focused specifically on helping employers navigate the campus who are looking for more diverse talent using innovative approaches including integrating experiential learning, storytelling, and creativity into employer recruitment strategies .
Required Qualifications
Master’s in Education, Communication, Sociology, African American/Latinx studies or related field that demonstrates knowledge and understanding of advanced cultural competence. Demonstrated collaborative work experience to create educational programs and content
2+ years of pedagogical experience, including workshop design and/or teaching in higher education. Demonstrated advising experience in 1:1 or group settings. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. A minimum of 5+ years of experience working in higher education and/or educational settings. Experience working with diverse student populations on issues related to professional development, communication, mentorship, faculty development, and the future of work. Knowledge of the specific career-related needs for master’s and Ph.D.students. Interest in working specifically with graduate students.
Preferred Qualifications
Ph.D. in a related field. 3+ years of experience teaching and advising on career and professional development topics with demonstrated expertise working with international and under-represented students. Demonstrated service or thought leadership working with under-represented communities.
Salary Range
$60,000 + depending on qualifications
Working Conditions
May work around standard office conditionsRepetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation
Required Materials
Resume/CV3 work references with their contact information; at least one reference should be from a supervisorLetter of interest

Title: Program Manager, Graduate Communities

Description:
At IDEA Public Schools, we believe in college for ALL and we are committed to ensuring that all our students graduate from college. IDEA Public Schools has grown from a small school to the fastest-growing network of tuition-free Pre-K-12 public charter schools in the United States sending 100% of our students to college. 50% of our students graduate from college in 6 years – that’s 8 times the national rate for students in our communities!
IDEA was founded in 2000 as a single school with 150 students in the Rio Grande Valley. When interest exceeded building capacity, to meet the demands, IDEA’s co-founders committed to serving more students in the Rio Grande Valley of Texas and beyond. We now serve nearly 53,000 students across Texas and Louisiana. By 2022, IDEA will serve 100,000 students. Be on the lookout for IDEA schools opening near you—with continued growth in our current regions and new launches in Houston (2020), Permian Basin (2020), and Tampa Bay (2021)!
When you choose to work at IDEA, you are part of our IDEA Team and Family. You will work alongside team members who set and reach ambitious goals every day, are excited to continue to grow with IDEA, and work relentlessly to make college for all a reality.
To learn more about IDEA, check out this video.
About Austin
Austin is a vibrant city filled with a rich cultural heritage and is ranked as the #1 Best Place to Live for the second year in a row by U.S. News and World Report. The city of Austin is the state capital and holds the ranking as the 11th largest city in the United States. Currently, Austin is home to 16 of IDEA’s schools and serves nearly 7,800 students at campuses in Austin, Kyle, and Pflugerville.
In a city that is a hub for knowledge, IDEA is working to support the community through education, which is the single most effective anti-poverty strategy we possess as a nation. This is why we focus on AP courses for all students, college acceptance, and matriculation. Only 1 in 8 Austin students graduate college ready. Changing this statistic is part of the promise IDEA makes to current and incoming students. Our goal is to add 16 more schools over the next 4 years, including IDEA’s first health professions school, in support of our mission of college for all, positioning us to serve approximately 13,000 students by 2022. The Advancement Team Data Analyst will play a critical role in enabling the Advancement team to raise over $70M to support college scholarships & expansion. The Data Analyst supports the Advancement team by maintaining and developing the fundraising data infrastructure that allows the team to make data-driven decisions around effectiveness and efficiency of our donor engagement and stewardship efforts. This is accomplished through developing and maintaining our donor management system and gift processing efforts, developing and maintaining dashboards and reports that are user-friendly and accessible to a broader audience, understanding best practices and making recommendations for process improvement, and providing meaningful insights to drive the work of our Advancement team.
Accountabilities

Why be an Operator at CSG?

Description:
School Action Fund Manager (Manager V) (00010530) TEXAS EDUCATION AGENCY Texas-Austin Texas Education Agency 1701 NORTH CONGRESS AVENUE Austin 78701 Management Regular Full-time 40.00 Yes, 10 % of the Time 1604 B 26 5,784.58 - 7,083.33 (Monthly) 1 Exempt Sep 4, 2020, 5:15:47 PM Ongoing
Description The Texas Education Agency (TEA) will improve outcomes for all public-school students in the state by providing leadership, guidance, and support to school systems.
This position is funded through September 30, 2022 under the federal CARES Act grant. Continuation of the position beyond that date is contingent on available funding. In order to advance the mission of the TEA of improving outcomes for all public school students and to support districts in their response to COVID-19, the School Action Fund Grant Manager supports multiple school districts to plan and execute strategic, sustainable, and successful school actions to launch new, replicate successful, redesign existing schools, restart struggling schools, and reassign students to higher-performing schools. The School Action Fund Grant Manager leads the School Action Fund support team to build a pipeline of future SAF grantees, track and monitor SAF implementation progress, and ensure the success of high-quality school actions in conjunction with School Action Fund Technical Assistance Providers and other support providers. The School Action Fund Grant Manager reports directly to the Director of the Division of System Support and Innovation and oversees a team of two School Action Fund Grant Specialists to design and execute all components of the School Action Fund featuring a focus on high-quality curriculum delivered in blended and asynchronous methods, extended school day and/or year, high-dose tutoring, and mental health and social resiliency supports.
Please note that a resume and tailored cover letter are required attachments for applying to this position. Incomplete applications will not be considered.
Additionally, please be sure to respond to the short answer prompts found in the supplemental questions. These responses should be added in a separate Word or PDF document in the attachments section of the application.
Applicants who are strongly being considered for employment must submit to a national criminal history background check.
Supports multiple school districts to plan and execute strategic, sustainable, successful school actions to launch new, replicate successful, redesign existing schools, restart struggling schools, and reassign students to higher-performing schools with a focus on COVID-19 responseOversees fidelity of implementation for School Action Fund grants and influences course corrections with appropriate support partners and technical assistance providersBuilds and maintains connections with support and technical assistance providers to ensure districts are provided best-in-class resources and coachingOversees the development of and execution of all components of the School Action Fund grant including but not limited to grant program applications and guidelines, Fidelity of Implementation Trackers, continuation funding applications and guidelines and the materials used to communicate this information to internal and external stakeholdersRecruits, develops, and retains a high-performing team to reach ambitious goals
Qualifications Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university. Advanced degree or major course work in a field relevant to the assignment is generally preferred. At least (6) years of experience in the education sector.
Documented experience in system level school reforms, particularly in school portfolio management, performance-based accountability, school choice programs, district charter partnerships, school autonomy and empowerment, new school creation or design, and school redesignsKnowledge of state (e.g. SB 1882) and federal laws (e.g. Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) related to state agency actions in support of school districts and schools)Knowledge of blending learning models and other asynchronous education delivery modelsAbility to quickly comprehend complex information and break it into comprehensive partsExpertise in influencing and motivating others to a desired outcomeHighly organized with ability to develop and execute project plans and progress monitoring toolsExperience in developing and managing critical relationships that include but are not limited to internal TEA staff, district superintendent and leadership team-level partners, and external organizations (non-profits, foundations, consultants, etc.)Skill in qualitative and quantitative analysis; and creating MS PowerPoint, Excel, and Word-based toolkits, guides, and resourcesA desire to self-reflect, give/receive feedback and continuously improveDemonstrates outstanding leadership and personal relations skills including excellent written and oral communication skills.
As an equal opportunity employer, we hire without consideration to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, disability, or veteran status, unless an applicant is entitled to the veteran’s preference.
Additional Military Crosswalk (occupational specialty code) information can be accessed here.
This position requires the applicant to meet Agency standards and criteria which may include passing a pre-employment criminal background check, prior to being offered employment by the Agency.
No phone calls or emails, please. Due to the high volume of applications, we do not accept telephone calls and cannot reply to all email inquiries. Only candidates selected for interview will be contacted.
Title: School Action Fund Manager (Manager V)

Description:
Do you want to change the world? We do, too.
The energy market is roughly $4 trillion globally, and solar penetration is less than 1%. But just one hour of sunlight, if harnessed, could power the entire world for a year. We have the opportunity to completely change the way energy is produced, distributed and consumed on a global scale, and we’re looking for talented, committed people to help us drive our growth and achieve our goals.
SunPower is a global solar energy solutions company with a rich heritage of pioneering the best energy technologies in the world. Our solutions are unrivaled in terms of long-term reliability, efficiency and guaranteed performance, and our company is unmatched in terms of global reach and scale. Through design, manufacturing, installation and ongoing maintenance and monitoring, SunPower provides its proprietary, world-record efficient solar technology to residential, commercial and utility customers worldwide.
SunPower is changing the way our world is powered every day with a brilliant, passionate and driven team of more than 7,000 in North America, Europe, Africa, Asia and Australia. In an industry that is reshaping the world’s energy future, there’s no better place to be than SunPower.
We believe that our employees create our brand – with each project, each communication, each task completed and each interaction. Experience is critical to SunPower in regards to not only our customers but also our employees and dealer partners. As such, we strive to hire candidates that are service focused. The experience we would expect the ideal person to deliver is:
SUMMARY OF ROLE
SunPower is seeking a Solar Incentive Associate to join the Financial Operations team in our North American Channels business. The Solar Incentive Associate will be responsible in ensuring the priced incentives is collected from Utilities and the structured economics are met to maximize cash flow. We are looking for a renewable policy enthusiast, who is a self-starter and likes to solve complex problems with great interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to interface and maintain relationships at all levels of an internal and external organization.
Additionally, the Solar Incentive Associate will be required to understand complex Solar and Storage Incentive Program’s policy and creates an efficient and sustainable operational process around it. This role is cross-functional and requires a highly-motivated, entrepreneurial, and flexible individual who can iterate and operate in a fluid business context.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop a detailed understanding of residential Solar and Storage incentives in key marketsManage communication with Incentive Authorities in various Federal and State Jurisdictions.Onboard new solar incentive program, including but not limited to creating a conceptual framework and detailed Operational requirement checklist.Design a sustainable process to effectively manage Solar Incentives (Rebate, PBI, SREC, REC) cash flowProvide feedback based on gathered competitive intelligence and Actual result to benchmark and improve Incentive Pricing and FinancingDefine metrics and develop reports to be used to measure and evaluate the profitability of Solar IncentivesReview trends and volume metrics to identify possible gaps in the process, opportunities or potential issues.Collaborate with other departments in resolving Solar Incentives related issues or improving the processManage Self-Generation Incentive Program (SGIP) requirement with Dealer and CustomersOther duties as required to support team objectives
REQUIREMENTS
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze information with attention to detail and accuracy
OTHER PERTINENT INFORMATION

Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is seeking a Lease Administrator who can move fast and communicate effectively to enable the continued growth of our facilities portfolio. As a key contributor on our growing Portfolio Administration team at Facebook, you will be responsible for understanding and improving our portfolio administration processes, collaborating effectively with our third-party lease administration vendor, and managing relationships with cross-functional business partners. The successful candidate will be an energetic, self-motivated, and solution-focused individual who can work well with internal and external partners at multiple levels. The ideal candidate will have experience working in a fast-paced environment with large amounts of data. The ability to build and maintain strong working relationships is critical for this role.

Description:
This position is located at our Austin Office, however, at this time during the Covid-19 Pandemic, The Hotline expects to be working remotely at least through 12/2020. To be eligible for this position, you must reside or plan to relocate to the Austin area. We will continue to evaluate when it is safe to return to our office, based on CDC recommendations. Candidates for this position need to be able to work remotely temporary with the expectation of returning to our Austin Office."
General Position Purpose Statement
The Donor Database Specialist reports to the Development and Marketing Manager and is responsible for the overall management of The Hotline's donor database (currently Raiser's Edge 7/NXT). This includes managing data integrity, gift entry and acknowledgements, one-to-many donor stewardship, conducting query and list generation in support of donor appeals as well as performing high-level database amendments with little supervision. This position will also develop and use best practice processes and procedures building upon what currently exists, conduct gift analysis, regular reporting, and tracking.
The National Domestic Violence Hotline (The Hotline) provides support and services to those affected by relationship abuse 24/7/365. All of our work is informed by, and conducted through, adherence to, the values of The Hotline:We conduct every aspect of our work to the highest ethical standards and hold ourselves accountable to them. We value transparency and staunchly safeguard the confidentiality of those we serve.We are committed to learning constantly, developing innovative practices and evolving strategies as necessary to achieve our mission and vision.We value performance and results. We aspire to be the best and to embrace the challenge to exceed expectations.We work as a team within the organization and with a wide range of partners outside of it, in the belief that only through these partnerships will we achieve the broadest impact.We value diverse perspectives and strive to incorporate an anti-oppression lens in all aspects of our work.We conduct our work with compassion and in the spirit of inclusion, and we meet all individuals with respect and without judgment.Our work begins and ends with the interests of survivors of relationship abuse in mind.
Compensation
43k-48k
Essential Responsibilities
Database Management
Ability to perform high-level database procedures utilizing the RE Query module; assign and make updates to queries of constituent information, specifically but not limited to Assigned Appeals, Actions, Constituent Attributes, among other available fields.Use best practice research to determine the appropriate data to track within the database and related coding to create more sustainable and accurate donor data.Generate and provide accurate Constituent Lists, with appropriate exclusions, to support donor email and mailed appeals or other forms of communication, manage Consent related functionality and concerns, and process sign-ups.Proactively determine donor trends and share them with the development team to develop opportunities for moves management to increase giving and re-engage lapsed donors.Demonstrates an awareness and ability to think strategically about donor and/or gift-related fields, such as but not limited to, Campaign, Fund, and Appeal management and reporting within the Raiser's Edge/NXT.Execute Imports and other Global Add, Change, and/or Delete functions with precision and accuracy; reviewing data before, during, and after task completion.
Donor Relations
Manage gift entry of all donations (online and offline) into the Raiser's Edge/NXT, as well as create new donor records and/or make appropriate updates to current constituent records in a timely fashion.Produce accurate donor acknowledgement letters regularly, identifying when customization is necessary.Manage and complete one-to-many donor stewardship per Development's standard operating procedures.Assist with the development and execution of donor appeals and other stewardship-related items, as appropriate.
Reporting
Report the performance and accuracy of donor appeals per gift coding standards, with quality and thorough review of reports prior to dissemination.Compile and distribute weekly, monthly and yearly gift reports for Development and Finance. Coordinate with Finance on reconciliation, as needed, to ensure accuracy.Accurately produce monthly dashboard reports for Development and the Board.
Other
Fielding requests from the development email and donor relations phone lineOther duties as assigned.
This description only includes essential functions of the job and does not imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow and any other job-related instruction and to perform any other job-related duties requested by his or her supervisor or management.
Job Requirements and Responsibilities
One to two years of Raiser's Edge/Raiser's Edge NXT, or a similar donor database, experience, required.Blackbaud Certification in the Raiser's Edge (bCRE), preferred.Ability to maintain strict confidentiality of employee, donor, funder, and constituent information.Highly organized, self-sufficient, and able to manage time and multiple projects on deadline.Attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and data-driven thinking a must.Experience with data entry, reconciliation, and analyzing a compilation of numerical data for financial reporting.Proficient to expert in working with Windows 2000 and above, especially Excel and Word.Ability to work with and respond with sensitivity and awareness to those with diverse cultural, ethnic, and social backgrounds, values, attitudes, and languages.Excellent written and oral communication skills in composition and proofreading including good command of English grammar and spelling.Ability to interact professionally and effectively with a diverse group of fellow team members, executives, managers, external groups and subject matter experts.Ability to carry out and articulate with passion the mission, vision, programs and purposes of the organization.Intentionally and actively, foster positive working relationships and organizational culture.High school diploma or equivalent.
Other Requirements/Working Conditions
Ability to read, write and converse in English and tolerate prolonged sitting orWe periodically receive calls or emails from donors/survivors who want to share their story, which times, can be very personal. We expect this position to handle these calls with care, compassion and discretion knowing at all times we are a survivor-centered
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and minimum level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as exhaustive of all duties, responsibilities and skills required for the position. Description:
AlertMedia is seeking PR Manager with extensive experience managing this function within a fast-growing B2B tech company. We're looking for a thoughtful storyteller to join our communications team. In this role, you will help drive a results-driven public relations program. You will work closely with the executive team, internal stakeholders, reporters, and industry experts to drive awareness of AlertMedia within the emergency communication space.
Whether it is telling the world about our latest product release, amplifying a customer success story, collaborating with an industry partner or creating a thought leadership platform, you will work with teams across the company to drive programs that establish and build on AlertMedia's relevance in the market.
AlertMedia is leading the evolution of employee safety for a modern workforce. We offer the most intuitive emergency communication software on the market with fully integrated threat warnings and employee safety monitoring. We believe any organization can improve safety and business outcomes during critical events by quickly identifying threats and simplifying fast, reliable communication to impacted audiences. We are headquartered in Austin, TX, and trusted by thousands of customers in over 100 countries—including DHL, British Petroleum, SurveyMonkey, and Walmart—to keep their people safe and connected anytime, anywhere.
We are an equal opportunity employer focused on creating a collaborative and exciting place for all to work. Ensuring a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace for all people is key to our success and core to our values.
Come join us in our mission to save lives and minimize loss through effective communication.
This is an amazing opportunity to be part of our wave of momentum and take our company, and your career, to the next growth stage. We'd love to get to know you better and share how we serve our amazing customers. For more information please visit www.alertmedia.com.
Partner with entire marketing team to create a full-funnel integrated PR strategy in support of business goalsRegularly create innovative content that helps spread the word about how we are helping our customers protect their people during critical eventsPartner with customer marketing and customer success team to identify media opportunities within our customer basePursue media coverage (local, industry, and national), interviews, and partner with internal team members to write contributed articlesPartner with external PR consultant for media pitching opportunities and to build PR strategyResearch and evaluate opportunities for AlertMedia to present at relevant industry eventsManage and submit to award programs that will promote AlertMedia's product offering and employer brandBuild and manage PR calendar as part of broader communications calendarMonitor news as it relates to our industryTrack, measure, and report on impact of PR efforts
5+ years B2B Technology PR experience (in-house experience preferred)Can develop and execute on communication strategies for a diverse set of programsAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlinesAbility to leverage existing strong media relationships with both tech, trade, and business pressTarget-oriented and resourceful, with a positive, flexible mindsetCan showcase proven results from a variety of past PR campaigns across national, local and industry publicationsRoll-up-your sleeves mentality with a willingness to work cross-functionally within the team as needed
Competitive base salary + Company-Wide Bonus programStock options - Be a shareholder in the companyCompetitive PTO + holidays to enjoy balanceHealth benefits - Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance 100% paid for employeesAmazing rewards and incentivesAn exciting and positive work environmentCommitment to community service with opportunities to give backA Best Places to Work company 4 years in a row
