Description:
Position Summary
We have the opportunity for an experienced Research & Knowledge Analyst to join the firm’s Knowledge Management department. The Research & Knowledge Analyst will perform legal and business research to support firm needs. The position reports to the Sr. Manager of Research Services and may be based in Kansas City, Austin, Dallas, or Chicago.
Essential FunctionsProvides research services for the firm’s attorneys and staff including quick reference and in-depth public records, legal, and business research using appropriate electronic resourcesEvaluates research results and provides concise summaries of findingsFields questions from attorneys and staff via phone, in person, and email, and escalates when necessaryActs as an advisor to attorneys and staff in the selection and navigation of resourcesCommunicates with courts, court runner services, and vendorsAccurately records billable and non-billable research in firm’s time entry system, in accordance with firm policyMonitors practice-specific, industry, legal, client, and subject topics through alerts created on online databases to keep attorneys and other staff members informed of current developments and activitiesParticipates in the evaluation of new and updated versions of resources to determine if subscribing is warrantedParticipates in collaborative Research Services meetings (video conference)Conducts onboarding training for lateral attorneys and staffIdentifies opportunities for process improvement as it relates to the position’s responsibilitiesWorks on special projects to support Knowledge Management, other administrative departments, and practice groupsKeeps abreast of available research tools applicable to the position’s responsibilities; developments with current research tools; and developments in research concepts, techniques, and methodsCollaborates with the Knowledge Management team to develop and implement innovative products and servicesParticipates in professional development through internal and external training and involvement in professional associationsMaintains strict confidentiality of firm mattersModels qualities and performance desired in firm employees, including attendance, professionalism, and quality work productUses resources in compliance with firm’s policiesRequirementsBachelor’s degree required, MLS and/or JD preferred5+ years of law firm library/research services experience preferredProficient in use of Quest, Westlaw, Lexis Advance, Bloomberg Law, Lexis Practice Advisor, CHEETAH, Checkpoint, Courthouse News Service (CNS), LexisNexis Courtlink, PACER, HeinOnline, Hoover’s, Monitor Suite, Accurint, TLO, and other library research resourcesPossesses knowledge of cost-effective research techniquesAbility to create online search criteria using stemming and operatorsExperience using integrated library systemsWorking knowledge of Microsoft applications, including but not limited to Outlook, Word, and Excel as well as the Document Management System iManage FileSiteProficient in video conferencing tools Teams and Skype for BusinessPossesses excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, facilitating effective working relationshipsStrong attention to both detail and accuracyAbility to work independently and efficiently under time constraints and be able to thrive within the firm’s highly dynamic environmentTeam player, customer service focused, and adept at handling multiple projects and shifting prioritiesInitiative and problem-solving abilitiesKeen interest in innovation and technology, and ability to quickly learn new platforms
Please note, we are not working with outside recruiters for this position.
Benefits
Ogletree Deakins offers a robust suite of benefits for our Staff including: Paid Time Off, Sick Time, a 401(k) matching program, Profit Sharing, Paid Holidays, Paid Parental Leave, affordable Health and Life Insurance including Dental & Vision coverage, Health Savings Account /Flexible Spending Accounts to help offset the cost of dependent care and/or health care expenses, Teladoc (24/7 access to a doctor by phone or online video), Tuition Reimbursement and an Employee Assistance Program.
Firm Overview
Ogletree Deakins is one of the largest labor and employment law firms representing management in all types of employment-related legal matters. Premier client service, as outlined in the firm’s Client Pledge, is one of the firm’s top priorities and a cornerstone of its core values. U.S. News – Best Lawyers® “Best Law Firms” has named Ogletree Deakins a “Law Firm of the Year” for nine consecutive years. In 2020, the publication named Ogletree Deakins its “Law Firm of the Year” in the Labor Law – Management and Litigation – ERISA categories. Ogletree Deakins has more than 900 attorneys located in 53 offices across the United States and in Europe, Canada, and Mexico. The firm represents a diverse range of clients, from small businesses to Fortune 50 companies.
We are fully committed to the importance of diversity within the legal profession, as well as all workplace environments and strongly encourage the interest of diverse candidates in the firm.
Equal Opportunity Employer.

Description:
Essential FunctionsThe Employees Retirement System (ERS) supports state employees who have dedicated their career to supporting Texas! Our mission is to offer competitive benefits to enhance the lives of our members. Our Human Resources division is seeking an experienced HR Specialist to perform complex Human Resources management work including performance management, applicant screening and tracking, classification review and compliance, salary actions, and assisting with training and development initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a critical eye for attention to detail, initiative to explore new ideas, and enjoy working in a team environment.ERS promotes a strong work-life balance while driving employee excellence through professional development, a collaborative working environment and a competitive benefits package.
Assist with classification reviews to ensure proper classification, research market data; assist with classification audits; and may provide coordination and assistance with job analysis requests.Prepare, review and maintain up-to-date job descriptions in electronic and paper files. Coordinate with supervisors on job description development, maintenance and appropriate classification as related to the SAO Classification Plan, and federal and agency requirements.Review, verify, process, and maintain personnel related documentation for internal and external candidate selections and personnel salary actions according to HR procedures, policies and statues.Perform and prepare salary compensation data reports and classification compliance audits for management and for decision making.Review and process agency performance evaluations and ensure compliance with the SAO Classification Plan, FLSA, and agency policies.Enter performance evaluation rating data into agency system.Process and produce monthly completion/delinquent reports and distribute to agency management and leadership team.Screen and review employment applications; evaluates applicant qualifications; and refer qualified applicants to appropriate hiring manager.Assist with entering and maintaining data into applicant tracking systems and reporting databases.Review, verify, and process hire selections and ensure documents are in compliance with EEO policies, agency policies, and department procedures.Coordinate and communicate with hiring managers on any discrepancies or documentation needed for processing internal and external hire selections.Perform research on training opportunities and offerings based on Agency’s strategic plan and/or initiatives, and provide and present analysis and recommendations to HR team.Perform electronic and paper records in accordance to record retention policy and departmental procedures. File materials into personnel files; maintain and organize records and documents.Required Minimum QualificationsGraduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in human resource management, business or a related field. Each year of related experience over the required minimum may be substituted for one year (30 semester hours) of required college credit.Four (4) years of experience in highly complex human resource management work must include all of the following:Experience in researching job market and human resources related topics.Experience performing data and job analysis and reporting.Experience disseminating and interpreting governmental statues and organizational policies to various audiences.Two (2) years recent (2015 and after) experience in classification and compensation reviews and screening applications for hiring selections.Preferred QualificationsPHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, or SHRM-SCP.Recent work experience in a governmental human resources capacity where primary function included use of SAO classification plan for recruitment, hiring, and performance evaluations activities.Experience with CAPPS RecruitOther Information All applications must contain complete job histories, which includes job title, dates of employment, name of employer, supervisor's name and phone number and a description of duties performed. If this information is not submitted, your application may be rejected because it is incomplete. Resumes do not take the place of this required information. Work is performed in an office environment. This position may require access to privileged, confidential, or sensitive data. ERS will conduct either a TXDPS or FBI criminal history check on all new hires. For more information about this policy inquiries can be made to employment@ers.texas.gov.Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) CodesVeterans, Reservists or Guardsmen with experience in the Military Occupational Specialty (http://www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_HumanResources.pdf) along with the minimum qualifications listed above may meet the minimum requirements and are highly encouraged to apply. Please contact Human Resources at employment@ers.texas.gov with questions or for additional information.

We are on a mission to continually source and attract top talent. Because of this, we are consistently seeking candidates for current and future consideration. If you believe your skills, experience, and passion would be a great fit for Francesca’s, we encourage you to apply today!.
At Francesca’s, our Sales Associates are called Stylists. The successful Stylist candidate is a fashion savvy member of a Boutique Team who is motivated to provide a superior guest experience to maximize sales and profit. Under the guidance of the Boutique Leadership team, the Stylist is responsible for ensuring that sales goals are achieved by supporting and executing brand standards for our guest and team. This will include assisting with guests needs, offering product knowledge, merchandising, handling cash transactions, and maintaining a neat and visually inspiring boutique environment.
Candidates must be able to work a flexible schedule according to the needs of the business, including evenings, weekends and holidays.

Description:
The Molecular Biologist will provide support to develop novel solutions for current and future projects involving operation and analysis of molecular assays with a specific focus on next generation sequencing (NGS). The introduction of NGS and other rapid characterization technologies have led to an exponential increase of data acquisition and to concomitant bottlenecks regarding data storage, computational needs, and novel systematic and random error issues.
Lead and manage the tissue culture facility. Maintain cell lines, manage schedules and facilities, and expand the overall capability toward the execution of future research programs.Produce viral vectors and leverage state-of-the-art synthetic biological tools to achieve project goals.Perform advanced molecular cloning, producing diverse molecular libraries that can be utilized for directed evolution or rapid screening assays.Perform tasks on various research and development activities to include human forensics, microbial forensics, and chemical forensics.Work as an integrated member of a multidisciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, and engineers.Act as a subject matter expert in the fields of tissue culture, virology, and synthetic biology.Support projects through employing efficient and accurate data evaluation techniques, placing levels of statistical confidence on data output, and clearly reporting results.Interact with clients and present technical data through presentations and report writing.Help grow the company through the successful and timely execution of projects, positive interactions with clients, recognition of opportunities for follow-on work with existing clients, establishment of new opportunities with alternate clients, proposal development and writing support, internal research and development, and maintaining a presence at marketing and business development meetings/conferences.Be motivated to contribute in a team environment, collaborate across multiple scientific and technical disciplines, and be excited to develop new skills.Have the flexibility to balance multiple on-going tasks while operating efficiently with minimal supervisionTravel to project and business development meetings as needed.
Must have extensive experience performing mammalian tissue culture to include maintenance of cell lines, DNA or RNA transfection, and detection of common reporter gene methods (e.g., fluorescent proteins, antibiotic resistance).Must have demonstrated experience performing molecular cloning using modern techniques. Experience producing libraries of DNA variants, such as those used in directed evolution experiments, is preferred.Must have extensive experience performing molecular biological techniques to include nucleic acid extraction, PCR, next generation sequencing (NGS) library preparation, NGS data analysis, and protein purification and analysis (e.g., electrophoresis, ELISA, LC-MS).Must have demonstrated experience with DNA sequence analysis including primer design and confirmation of DNA constructs. Experience analyzing NGS data using command line tools is preferred.Experience working with or producing viral vectors is strongly preferred.Knowledge of basic virology concepts is preferred.Demonstrated experience documenting and communicating scientific results in the form of scientific reports, publications, or presentations is required.At least working knowledge of or experience in R, Python, and/or MATLAB or other relevant statistical analysis tools is required.A demonstrated capability to meet technically ambitious timelines and goals is required. The capacity to rapidly, creatively troubleshoot and adapt as results are generated is essential.Candidates must be willing to submit and be eligible for a DoD secret clearance (i.e., must be subject to and pass a background investigation and must be a U.S. citizen).Must be able to do extended deskwork at a computerMust be able to stand for several hours at a time to perform lab workMust be able to wear standard PPE (e.g., mask, gloves, lab coat) for extended periods of time
Degree in Biology, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Bioinformatics, or related field
Ph.D. – None required; M.S. – at least five years of experience in a related field
None
This position requires that the candidate be willing and able to complete a successful background screening for a security clearance.
None
Will split time working in the laboratory and at a computer. Must be able to stand for extended periods while doing lab work, sit for extended periods and work at a computer, and carry light loads
The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.
Title: Molecular Biologist

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Life@'s mission is to help care for you while you’re bringing the world closer together. We take a holistic and market-based approach to benefits and programs that give you and your loved ones resources you need to thrive in every stage of life. We are looking for a Program Delivery, Health Program Manager to join the Life@ team who can help drive projects, process improvement and delivery of plans to ensure a high touch employee experience. We need someone who is highly motivated, solution driven, exceptionally organized and has a strong attention to detail with equal consideration of “big picture,” with maturity and tact.

Description:
AlertMedia is seeking a Global Intelligence Analyst to join our newly formed Global Intelligence team. This role will play a critical part in making sure our customers are provided with timely and accurate information when there is a critical event in their area. As a Global Intelligence Analyst, you will discern what information is important and relevant through the utilization of a variety of source tools then relay that information to our customers. This position requires laser-sharp focus, pristine attention-to-detail, clear and effective communication skills and the ability to reason. You must have the ability to make quick and thoughtful decisions with the understanding that the information you are sharing could be critical.
You have previous job experience in the news media, as a security or intelligence analyst, or another role which required you to be mission-focused, analytical, highly organized and work within time constraints. You're inspired to make a difference and understand the importance and responsibility of supporting valued customers during critical events. You have sound judgement with the ability to make difficult decisions under pressure. You're an independent problem solver but also capable of working collaboratively in support of a larger team.
AlertMedia is leading the evolution of employee safety for a modern workforce. We offer the most intuitive emergency communication software on the market with fully integrated threat warnings and employee safety monitoring. We believe any organization can improve safety and business outcomes during critical events by quickly identifying threats and simplifying fast, reliable communication to impacted audiences. We are headquartered in Austin, TX, and trusted by thousands of customers in over 100 countries—including DHL, British Petroleum, SurveyMonkey, and Walmart—to keep their people safe and connected anytime, anywhere.
We are an equal opportunity employer focused on creating a collaborative and exciting place for all to work. Ensuring a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace for all people is key to our success and core to our values.
Come join us in our mission to save lives and minimize loss through effective communication.
This is an amazing opportunity to be part of our wave of momentum and take our company, and your career, to the next growth stage. We'd love to get to know you better and share how we serve our amazing customers. For more information please visit www.alertmedia.com.
Utilize source tools to identify and monitor incidents and potential threats globallyBased on given criteria, identify events that could impact business continuity and the safety of our customers and their employeesCommunicate critical information effectively and with urgency and provide updated information as necessaryEnsure that all information is delivered with the highest level of accuracy and speedWork with AlertMedia's Global Intelligence team to continuously update sources to ensure the highest level of monitoring and knowledge
2+ years of professional business experience, particularly in roles demanding analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong judgement and decision-making skills based on given criteria; ability to evaluate a variety of situations, establish priorities and provide accurate information with urgencyGeneral knowledge of current eventsAbility to multitask effectively with strong attention to detailStrong written and verbal communications skillsStrong understanding of existing social media platforms and ability to learn and utilize a variety of tools and systemsCapable of working independently on a task or tasks while also thriving and collaborating as part of a larger teamAbility to work under stressful situations, in a fast-paced environment with critical timelinesDesire to be a part of building something new, exciting and evolvingA willing partner in giving and receiving feedback on product, process and performanceAs a key player in a 24/7 team, this role requires commitment to your agreed upon shift with ability/flexibility of hours as needed to support the business. Description:
About GM
There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.
To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.
Why Work for Us
Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.
Job Description
In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM’s global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed and business value.
The Associate IT Planner will assist with planning a Global Sales, Marketing, and Customer Experience multi-year Portfolio that is data driven, based on strategic roadmaps, and has high business value. The Associate IT Planner will support execution of the approved portfolio to ensure successful delivery. Applicants must possess skills to develop effective relationships with key stakeholders by expressing an understanding of business processes, desired business outcomes, and technical roadmaps.
Portfolio Planning/Communications
Support the end to end collaborative effort between Business Analysts, Requirements Analysts, Program / Project Managers, Development Teams, and Test LeadsCoordinate with Business Analysts to capture scope in the form of high-quality Briefs and help facilitate leadership reviewsCommunications support, including coordination and event management for All People meetings, managing agendas and content for staff meetings and program updates with leadership, tracking of actions and outcomes, and drafting monthly updates to leadership and business stakeholders regarding project outcomes and successesSupport for portfolio management, including coordinating reviews, leadership updates, strategic planning and process changeSupport for new hire onboarding and trainingAssist in identification and resolution of data quality issues in PPM and TFSWork with and leverage the GSMC Reporting and Analytics team to drive data quality improvement in systems of record (CBA, PPM, ASMS, etc)
Team members must possess business insight, creativity, decision making skills, a drive for results, ability to negotiate and develop strong peer relationships, and a strong technical learning capability.
Benefits Overview
The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Diversity Information
General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. Title: Tailors

Description:
The Role
The Installation Quality Specialist will be the critical link between field installations, local operations and operations leadership, Channel account managers, and the Installation Quality Manager/HQ Quality and Training Team. They will be the primary local agent in a positive feedback loop to improve and maintain installation quality in the region through data collection and direct communication and interaction with operations and installation crews.
The primary function of the Installation Quality Specialist is to perform Installation Quality Inspections on a daily basis within a targeted 72 hours of a job’s completion and/or On-the-Job-Training with Direct and Certified installers in all markets. Inspections/training will be conducted according to the published Tesla Energy Quality Standards, and all captured data will be entered into the Quality audit database for real-time reporting and sharing within and among all channels.
The Installation Quality Specialist will also work with their regional and national Quality Managers to create reports and content based on recent findings which will be presented to managers, individual crews, or entire offices/partnering companies on a regular basis through Warehouse Talks and meetings. The Installation Quality Specialist will also be available to assist with the launching of new offices or new crews, or to work with crews or offices that may be falling behind or having other systemic issues. Also, the Installation Quality Specialist will be an essential part of field testing and launching new products at the local level.
The Installation Quality Specialist must lead by example and provide the proper messaging and tone to their teammates and colleagues in Direct and Certified Installation Field Operations. This includes following all safety policies and[BF1] installation best practices, and providing best-in-the-world customer service. This also means serving as a field-facing ambassador who represents Tesla’s company culture and values, and who fosters a team spirit and supportive atmosphere for all employees. The Installation Quality Specialist will be instrumental in creating and maintaining a culture of quality within their region. It is necessary that they behave transparently, are self-directed, and believe in Tesla’s cause and vision for achieving it.
As a representative of the Quality team, it is critical that the Installation Quality Specialist shares the tools and messaging formulated by their local teammates, manager, and HQ-based quality team.
Responsibilities
Perform Installation Quality audits on minimum 10% of all installs and compile data based on the Quality Standards and Best PracticesWork with new or troubled crews/offices to implement Best Practices and Quality Standards: field work, targeted training, Warehouse Talks on pertinent quality subjects driven by quality data trends and observationsRegularly visit assigned Field Offices and present feedback directly to crews and ManagementPrepare a short, highly-focused slide deck (10 min presentation)Serve as a valued resource and Subject Matter Expert on installation, commissioning, and troubleshootingParticipate in pilot programs to deploy new products or processes and provide clear feedback to Installation Quality Manager and HQ teamAct as the HQ operations team representative to spearhead new product deployment efforts in the region
Requirements
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
Title: Installation Quality Specialist, Energy - Training and Quality Assurance

Description:
The Call Center Supervisor position is responsible for overseeing the daily activities of the program and for meeting or exceeding the personal performance measures established for this operational team/work unit. The unit is responsible for performing the following functions; processing orders, account maintenance, records maintenance customer service and complaint/problem resolution.
Utilize performance management information to supervise, coordinate and schedule the activities of leads and customer service representatives in assisting the manager with the achievement of the designated key performance indicatorsResponsible for effective administration of evaluations, coaching, mentoring, interviewing and hiring, and corrective actionsReview, approves and maintains time sheets and schedule adherence for staffMonitor and document incoming telephone calls and provides continuous feedback to staffAssures that daily performance reports are reviewed and utilized to manage the staff for continuous improvementProvide input and/or assistance in formulating new policies and procedures; recommend changes to existing policies and procedures as required to improve operations in efficient achievement of performance indicators or to support changing business requirementsCoordinates with other units or divisions as necessary to resolve issuesRegularly communicates with other units to foster an effective team environment and assure that these areas are aware of issues that may impact their areaEnsures compliance with state and federal laws, rules and guidelines, and policies and proceduresPerforms other work as required and assignedMinimum Requirements
Microsoft Office applicationsExcellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skillsDependable, accurate and detail oriented
Final candidates for this position will need to successfully complete drug screening and a background investigation, which may include a criminal and credit check
